quiz.title: Pre-calculus: Unit 7 Quiz 8
quiz.subtitle: 7.8: Applications of Right Triangle Trig
quiz.subject: Mathematics
quiz.topic: Real-world modeling and angles of elevation/depression

questions.question: A 20-foot ladder leans against a building, making a $60^\circ$ angle with the ground. Which function finds the height the ladder reaches?
questions.explanation: The ladder is the hypotenuse (20) and the height is the opposite side. $\sin \theta = \text{Opposite}/\text{Hypotenuse}$.

questions.question: Where is the 'Angle of Depression' measured from?
options: The object itself to the origin.
questions.explanation: Both elevation and depression must be measured from a horizontal reference line.

questions.question: If you are standing 50 feet from a tree and the angle of elevation to the top is $45^\circ$, how tall is the tree?
questions.explanation: At $45^\circ$, the opposite and adjacent sides are equal ($\tan(45^\circ) = 1$).

questions.question: True or False: The angle of elevation from Point A to Point B is equal to the angle of depression from Point B to Point A.
questions.explanation: They are alternate interior angles between two parallel horizontal lines, so they are always congruent.

questions.question: A surveyor needs to find the width of a river. They measure a distance along the bank (adjacent) and an angle to a point on the opposite bank. Which function is best?
questions.explanation: The width is the 'Opposite' side and the distance along the bank is 'Adjacent'. TOA uses Tangent.

questions.question: If a shadow is shorter than the object casting it, what can you say about the angle of elevation of the sun?
questions.explanation: $\tan \theta = \text{Height}/\text{Shadow}$. If Height > Shadow, $\tan \theta > 1$, which occurs when $\theta > 45^\circ$.

questions.question: A kite string is 100m long and makes a $30^\circ$ angle with the horizontal. How high is the kite?
In a right triangle application, what does the 'hypotenuse' typically represent?
questions.explanation: The hypotenuse usually represents a diagonal path, like a ladder, a string, or a direct line-of-sight.

questions.question: Find the length of a shadow cast by a 10m pole when the sun's angle of elevation is $60^\circ$.
When solving for an unknown angle in an application problem, which tool do you use?
questions.explanation: Inverse functions allow you to work backward from a ratio of sides to find the angle.

scoreMessages.90: Great job! You're ready to be a surveyor or an engineer.
scoreMessages.70: Good work. Always draw a diagram to identify your sides correctly!
scoreMessages.50: Remember: Elevation and Depression are always relative to the horizontal.
scoreMessages.0: Review how to set up SOH-CAH-TOA in word problems.
